Hackcenter.title: SUSI.AI Open Source Voice Assistant
Hackcenter.subtitle: Learn about SUSI.AI and how to build your own smart speaker
Hackcenter.description: We are developing a smart speaker that can play music through voice commands. Users can play music from online resources such as radio stations, YouTube, their cloud folder (e.g. Nextcloud) as well as from locally connected USB sticks or music available in the local network.

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Learn To Solder
Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: Day 1
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description:
Learn to Solder! A large variety of way cool kits are available, all designed for total beginners to complete successfully -- and intriguing enough for the total hardware geek.

'''''This ongoing workshop will be happening concurrently with lots of other way cool workshops at the Hardware Hacking Area! All day & all night, throughout all of CCCamp2019.'''''

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Surface Mount Electronics Assembly for Terrified Beginners - electronic kitten EXPERIMENTAL WORKSHOP
Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: EXPERIMENTAL Day 1 - 20:00
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description: Experimental new workshop - Surface mount electronics for terrified beginners. Learn to assemble tiny parts on circuit boards by building an electronic touch-activated purring kitten. Anyone can do it. Yes, even you who never touched anything electronic before. 90-100mins, 20€/kit, avoid caffeine immediately before. Max 6 participants per session, there is a PAPER!!1! signup list in the hardware hacking area.

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Arduino For Total Newbies
Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: Day 2
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description:
''Learn Arduino using TV-B-Gone as an example project''

You've probably heard lots about '''Arduino'''. But if you don't know what it is, or how you can use it to do all sorts of cool things, then this fun and easy workshop is for you. As an example project, we'll be creating a '''TV-B-Gone''' remote control out of an '''Arduino''' you can take home with you.

''(This is one of many cool things happening throughout CCCamp 2019 in the huge '''Hardware Hacking Area!)'''''

This workshop will be given twice
(both identical):
   Day 2: 22-Aug, 1pm - 4:30pm
   Day 3: 23-Aug, 1pm - 4:30pm

Village:Metalab Dome.title: Regio Mediation
Village:Metalab Dome.description: Streitigkeiten, die sich schon tiefer in einen Verein eingetreten haben oder sogar mit Machtgefällen behaftet sind, sind nicht einfach aus der Welt zu schaffen und können eine gute Vereinsarbeit über lange Zeit lähmen.  Wir glauben, um diese Probleme zu lösen, könnenn uns die Techniken der Mediation weiterhelfen.  Wir vermuten außerdem, dass schon viel Erfahrung im CCC und seinen Mitgliedern schlummert und wollen euch einladen mit uns Idee noch weiter auszuarbeiten.

Village:About:freedom.title: Freedom to go - an interactive workshop from An- to F- to G-Droid
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:sessions
Village:About:freedom.description: An interactive workshop to present the Free Software App repository called F-Droid and the outstanding functionalities of its clients called F-Droid and G-Droid.  After that we discover the best (imho!) Android-based Free Software apps including methods of anonymization and encryption - and you will have the possibility to present your personal favorite Free Software app as well.

Village:About:freedom.title: Global Climate Strike: exchange of ideas and experiences about organizing strikes and demonstrations
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:stage
Village:About:freedom.description: The climate crisis is an emergency but we’re not acting like it. Especially in political organizations like the Chaos Community this topic has to be more present, more visible. Our hotter planet is already hurting millions of people. We are not only in one of the best positions to provide technology for change, but we also should show that we belong to the people behind the movements like Fridays For Future or Global Climate Strike.

Village:Reclaim Club Culture.title: Club culture against the monopoly of Facebook
Village:Reclaim Club Culture.description: Reclaim Club Culture goes Feediverse, we want to learn about alternatives to facebook: We need a platform that includes social multimedia feeds and most importantly: a calendar for mobilization/invitation. We will prepare a campaign to get institutions of the cultural scene to use that alternative platform.

Village:Haecksen.title: Junges Chaos Bildet Banden
Village:Haecksen.description: Wir wollen Junge Leute im Chaos Umfeld vernetzen und die Jugendarbeit in den einzelnen Spaces stärken. Komm vorbei, trink eine Mate und lass die Welt verändern.

Village:Haecksen.title: Märchenstunde (für Erwachsene)
Village:Haecksen.subtitle: Teil 3: Meine Großmutter war ein Computer! - von den ENIAC Girls bis zum Harem von Pickering

Village:Kidspace.title: FabScanPi - 3D Laser Scanner Workshop
Village:Kidspace.subtitle: Build your own 3D-Scanner
Village:Kidspace.description: Build your own Open Source 3D Laser Scanner.

Village:Free Software Foundation Europe.title: Free Software Song sing-along
Village:Free Software Foundation Europe.description: Everyday at 19:30 in the Cluster about:freedom we invite you to sing together the Free Software song; We have the lyrics and a conductor. Simply come, bring your hacker buddies and your voice and maybe an instrument and we form an ad-hoc choir and sing out loud our love for Free Software!

Village:Harbor.subtitle: A short repetition of the talk from day 1 before the maritime hackers meetup
Village:Harbor.description: HFOS is the opensource vessel computer system

Village:Harbor.title: Maritime Hackers Meetup
Village:Harbor.description: Maritime hackers meet for socializing and discussion

Village:Fri3d Camp.title: IoT Meetup
Village:Fri3d Camp.description: Open meeting to discuss design & ethics of IoT

Village:C-base.title: Pentagame

Village:C-base.description: New abstract board game explained and played

Village:1komona.title: Postapokalyptic jewellery
Village:1komona.subtitle: scrap tinkering - schrottbasteln
Village:1komona.description: living in the postapocalypse and noticing the beauty of relicts of human civilisation, we start to adorn and grace ourselves with it. the workshop offers to create more or less pretty jewellery things out of a big collection of found objects. bring your own nuggets or choose from provided material. there will be a donation box as sad enough the apocalypse didn't make capitalism history.

Johnson (Workshop 1).title: Fair Ticket Sales on a Capitalist World
Johnson (Workshop 1).subtitle: Welcome to capitalism where prices regulate the differences between deman and supply, or do they?
Johnson (Workshop 1).description: In this open discussion we will discuss solutions taken by organizations to address ticket sales at fair prices when demand significantly outgrows supply

Village:About:freedom.title: Advanced web tracking methods
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:stage
Village:About:freedom.description: Advanced browser tracking techniques have developed over the last decade that allow remote sites to leverage the increasingly feature-rich web to track users without their knowledge or consent.  Not only are distinct visits across sites logged via techniques such as browser fingerprinting, sites that handle our most intimate details are monitoring our behavior on pages and handing that information to third parties with little to no regard to our privacy.  This will cover some of those advanced techniques that have emerged, and how to protect yourself against pervasive web tracking.

Village:About:freedom.title: Bandwidth Matters, Information controls in a conflict state in India
Village:About:freedom.description: What does information controls look like in conflict states of India? How does indias surveillance apparatus further intensify the information controls in conflict areas? How does this affect the everyday life of people esp women living and promoting peace in these regions?

Village:About:freedom.title: Decentrathon
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: Hacksession
Village:About:freedom.description: the decentralisation hackathon

Village:About:freedom.title: Decentrathon
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: Pitches
Village:About:freedom.description: the decentralisation hackathon

Village:About:freedom.title: Discussion on privacy-friendly green policies in the European Union
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:sessions
Village:About:freedom.description: How can we combine environmental issues with privacy-friendly solutions? Knowing that privacy comes at a cost of efficiency, what should the red lines be in the privacy VS environment debate? Is the fight for privacy in green policy the beginning of the end for surveillance capitalism?

Village:About:freedom.title: Freedom Cruise, about:PNR
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:stage

Village:About:freedom.title: How to shape a responsible world?
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: Follow up
Village:About:freedom.description: As activists we seek for a fundamental change in this world towards a fair and responsible society. The invited groups will give their analysis of the problems and present their work. Together we will identify questions or common projects we will work on in the follow-up workshops.

Village:About:freedom.title: Illegal content online – Bringing rights-based solutions to the EU table
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:stage
Village:About:freedom.description: EDRi proposes a political workshop to stress-test human rights-based solutions to ongoing debates in EU Brussels bubble: platforms' responsibilities towards illegal content online, prosecution of online crimes and conditions for law enforcement to access online evidence.

Village:About:freedom.title: Ink!: Write Wasm smart contracts with Rust
Village:About:freedom.description: A comprehensive, end-to-end tutorial for building an ERC20 token using Parity Substrate and ink! - build on Rust and wasm

Village:About:freedom.title: Substrate Collectibles - Build your own blockchain-backed asset exchange
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: Second Iteration
Village:About:freedom.description: This workshop will take you through building your own collectibles blockchain  - think "CryptoKitties" - using Substrate, Rust and WebAssembly.

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: ArduTouch music synthesizer
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description:
''Learn to solder together a cool, powerful music synthesizer,
       and learn to make cool music, sound, and noise!''

''(This is one of many cool things happening throughout CCCamp 2019 at the '''Hardware Hacking Area!)'''''

This workshop will be given:
   Day 4: 30-Dec, 1pm - 4pm

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Bristlebots for kids!
Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: Day 4
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description: DE/EN/FI Build a little electronic insect robot from a toothbrush and a motor

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Icibici
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description: build a simple brain-computer interface for €20

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Learn To Solder
Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: Day 4
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description:
Learn to Solder! A large variety of way cool kits are available, all designed for total beginners to complete successfully -- and intriguing enough for the total hardware geek.

'''''This ongoing workshop will be happening concurrently with lots of other way cool workshops at the Hardware Hacking Area! All day & all night, throughout all of CCCamp2019.'''''

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Surface Mount Electronics Assembly for Terrified Beginners - electronic kitten EXPERIMENTAL WORKSHOP
Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: EXPERIMENTAL Day 4 - 17:30
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description: Experimental new workshop - Surface mount electronics for terrified beginners. Learn to assemble tiny parts on circuit boards by building an electronic touch-activated purring kitten. Anyone can do it. Yes, even you who never touched anything electronic before. 90-100mins, 20€/kit, avoid caffeine immediately before. Max 6 participants per session, there is a PAPER!!1! signup list in the hardware hacking area.
